body:
@dhh [metric_fu uses the `rake stats` task](https://github.com/metricfu/metric_fu/blob/master/lib/metric_fu/metrics/stats/init.rb#L2), but only runs it on rails projects.  Besides that I've occasionally had issues with depending on being in a rails project to run the task, the rails CodeStatistics code can be used outside of rails.  For other evidence, there is a history of people pulling out the code and running their own forks. [1](https://github.com/nathanhumbert/rails_code_stats/) [2](https://github.com/cloudability/code_statistics/) [3](https://github.com/devver/code_statistics)

Besides that, do you think rails should provide a `rake stats` task? I think this is also in following with the extraction of https://github.com/rails/rails-perftest
